meanings.definition: A person who removes objectionable material from a text.
meanings.sent1: The expurgator carefully removed the inappropriate words from the book.
meanings.sent2: The expurgator was hired to clean up the novel before it was published.
meanings.sent3: The expurgator joked that their job was like being a literary detective.
meanings.sent4: She was an expurgator of negativity, always editing out pessimistic thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The expurgator's role was to sanitize the content, making it suitable for all readers.

meanings.definition: To remove objectionable material from a text.
meanings.sent1: He decided to expurgate the offensive language from the article.
meanings.sent2: She expurgated the explicit scenes from the movie script.
meanings.sent3: The writer expurgated the unnecessary details to make the story more concise.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like an expurgator, erasing memories that caused him pain.
meanings.sent5: The editor expurgated the manuscript, ensuring it met the publishing guidelines.
